channel.title: Weird case of null pointers at login
channel.description:
I know it is some update we have made that causes the error, but I'd like to see specifically, which piece of coding I have added that causes this problem.
[img]http://projectrainbow.net/GayGlitch.png[/img]
EDIT: Occasionally when you login, it will disconnect you and display those two null pointer errors. I have had the case of two of the same character logging in, and they will STAY logged in which is pretty annoying. Another thing is the unexpected server response which I got, 223 and 253, it is NOWHERE in the coding.
Please help! Justin

item.title: Weird case of null pointers at login
item.dc:creator: @whackatre Whackatre
item.description:
@whackatre wrote:

Hmm, but why would it send the client responses that haven’t even been programmed?

Read full topic
item.source: Weird case of null pointers at login

item.title: Weird case of null pointers at login
item.dc:creator: @imsuperman05 imsuperman05
item.description:
@imsuperman05 wrote:

It looks like it had a problem writing a file, so it started to throw those errors for that players host address.

Read full topic
item.source: Weird case of null pointers at login

item.title: Weird case of null pointers at login
item.dc:creator: @JavaTC JavaTC
item.description:
@JavaTC wrote:

It’s probably a problem with either your login handler or something in the client. I’m not that advanced with Java quite yet.

Read full topic
